cmds.help_message: Launch an AOs instance as administrator
Clear the screen
Shutdown the host machine
Restart the host machine
Lock the host machine
Display current time
Display today's date
Display AOs specific properties and configuration
Scan the integrity of all protected system files of host machine
Check for AOs updates
It's magic, it's magic.
Display messages
usage: shout [STRING]
Note: AOs follows the same string handling conventions as in C#.
Example usage:
shout Hello world!         # print Hello world! to the terminal
shout %username%           # print <YOUR-USERNAME> to the terminal
shout "%username%"       # print %username% to the terminal

cmds.help_message: Display the history of Commands
Call a specified program or command, given the full or sysenv path in terminal
usage: > [COMMAND]
Example usage:
>.                     # Open the current directory in file explorer
>cmd.exe               # Call the cmd in current instance of the terminal
>start myapp.exe       # Start an app from the terminal

cmds.help_message: Start a specified program or command, given the full or sysenv path
usage: open [COMMAND]
Example usage:
open .                 # Call the cmd in current instance of the terminal
open myapp.exe         # Start an app from the terminal

cmds.help_message: Change the title for the terminal window
usage: title [STRING]
Note: AOs follows the same string handling conventions as in C#.
Example usage:
title "My Terminal"          # Change the title to My Terminal
title                          # Reset the title to AOs

cmds.help_message: Change the default AOs foreground colors
usage: color [INT]
Example usage:
color 0            # Change the color to Black
color              # Reset the color to default
color help         # For information about other colors

cmds.help_message: Suspend processing of a command for the given number of seconds
usage: wait [INT]
Example usage:
wait           # Ask user about how many seconds to wait for
wait 10        # Wait for 10 second before continuing

cmds.help_message: Suspend processing of a command and display the message
usage: pause [STRING]
Note: AOs follows the same string handling conventions as in C#.
Example usage:
pause Pause for me please..            # Print Pause for me please.. to the terminal and pause until any key is pressed
pause                                  # Print Press any key to continue... and pause until any key is pressed

cmds.help_message: Start an installed program from the system
usage: cat [STRING]
Note: AOs follows the same string handling conventions as in C#.
Example usage:
cat "Google Chrome"          # Start Google Chrome
cat                            # List all the installed programs on the host machine

cmds.help_message: Change the terminal prompt
usage: prompt [OPTIONS] [STRING]
Note: AOs follows the same string handling conventions as in C#.
Example usage:
prompt Hello world!            # Change the prompt to Hello world!
prompt -p$-s                   # Change the prompt to "<current_path>$ "
prompt -r                      # Reset the custom prompt to AOs' default prompt
prompt                         # Reset the custom prompt to AOs' default prompt

cmds.help_message: Displays a list of files and subdirectories in a directory
usage: ls [STRING]
Note: AOs follows the same string handling conventions as in C#.
Example usage:
ls "C:\Program Files"           # List everything in directory "C:\Program Files"
ls ..                              # List everything in previous directory
ls                                 # List everything in the current directory

cmds.help_message: Change the current directory
usage: cd [STRING]
Note: AOs follows the same string handling conventions as in C#.
Example usage:
cd "C:\Program Files"           # Change directory to "C:\Program Files"
cd ..                              # Move to previous directory
cd                                 # Print the current directory path

cmds.help_message: Change to previous directory
Create a one or more files or folders
usage: touch [filepath (STRING)] [content (STRING)]
Note: AOs follows the same string handling conventions as in C#.
Example usage:
touch "dotnet.py" "me.txt"             # Create dotnet.py and me.txt
touch Folder/                              # Create an empty directory named Folder

cmds.help_message: Delete one or more files or folders
usage: del [filepath (STRING)]
Note: AOs follows the same string handling conventions as in C#.
Example usage:
del "dotnet.py" me.txt       # Delete dotnet.py and me.txt
del Folder/                    # Delete Folder directory

cmds.help_message: Rename a file or folder
usage: ren [target filepath (STRING)] [renamed filepath (STRING)]
Note: AOs follows the same string handling conventions as in C#.
Example usage:
ren "cpp.cs" swift.rust          # Rename cpp.cs to swift.rust
ren Folder/ Filer/                 # Rename Folder to Filer

cmds.help_message: Move a file or folder
usage: mv [target filepath (STRING)] [destination filepath (STRING)]
Note: AOs follows the same string handling conventions as in C#.
Example usage:
mv "C:\MyFolder\before.py" "C:\Users\Desktop\after.txt"       # Move before.py
mv Filer/ "D:\Dev\Filer"                                           # Move Filer directory

cmds.help_message: Copy a file or folder
usage: cp [target filepath (STRING)] [destination filepath (STRING)]
Note: AOs follows the same string handling conventions as in C#.
Example usage:
cp "C:\MyFolder\before.py" "C:\Users\Desktop\after.txt"       # Copy before.py
cp Filer/ "D:\Dev\Filer"                                           # Copy Filer directory

cmds.help_message: Start a website in a web browser
usage: pixelate [OPTIONS] [STRING]
Note: AOs follows the same string handling conventions as in C#.
Example usage:
pixelate "AOs Command-line Tool github"                                  # Search for a query
pixelate https://www.google.com                                            # Open google.com
pixelate -e youtube "How to make a game engine in one night?"            # Search for a query on a different search engine
pixelate -w                                                                # Search and show today's weather
pixelate --temp                                                            # Search and show today's temperature

supported_args.help_message: Search for a query on a specific search engine (google, bing, duckduckgo, youtube, wikipedia)
Display today's weather in a city (is_flag: true)
Display today's temperature in a city (is_flag: true)

cmds.help_message: Display the contents of a text file
usage: read [OPTIONS] [filepath (STRING)]
Note: AOs follows the same string handling conventions as in C#.
Example usage:
read google.html                   # Read a text file
read -l 24 google.html             # Read the 24th line of the text file

supported_args.help_message: Shows information about a specific line

cmds.help_message: Edit the contents of a text file
usage: commit [OPTIONS] [filepath (STRING)] [content (STRING)]
Note: AOs follows the same string handling conventions as in C#.
Example usage:
commit dogs.txt "dogs are good"                                  # Write some text to dogs.txt file.
commit -l 24 dogs.txt "other animals are good too."              # Write some text on the 24th line of the text file

supported_args.help_message: Edit specific line in a text file

cmds.help_message: Compress or Decompress files or folders
usage: zip [OPTIONS] [target filepath (STRING)] [compressed filepath (STRING)]
Note: AOs follows the same string handling conventions as in C#.
Example usage:
zip photos                         # Compress the photos folder
zip photos compressed              # Compress the photos folder into compressed
zip compressed photos -u           # Decompress the photos folder into compressed

cmds.help_message: Terminate a specific running process
usage: terminate [STRING]
Note: AOs follows the same string handling conventions as in C#.
Example usage:
terminate WindowsTerminal              # Kill the process of WindowsTerminal
terminate                              # List all the currently running processes

cmds.help_message: Control the host operating system volume
usage: vol [OPTIONS] [INT]
Example usage:
vol                    # Show the current volume level
vol -m                 # Mute or Unmute the system volume
vol 90                 # Set the system volume to 90%
vol -i -10             # Decrease the system volume by 10%
vol -i 10              # Increase the system volume by 10%

supported_args.help_message: Mute/Unmute the system master volume (is_flag: true)
Increase/Decrease the volume by then given value

cmds.help_message: Switch between applications using the App IDs
usage: switch [process_ID (INT)]
Example usage:
switch                 # List all currently running apps
switch <process-ID>    # Switch to an App with the process ID
